intro: Barleria argenteocalycina, commonly known as silverleaf barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a silvery or grayish underside, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pink or purple in color, arranged in dense spikes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides.
